title: Beneath Boris' anarchy there's now the chance of a more orderly Brexit
text:
Theresa May's Brexit was a carousel. Round and round it went, with no way to get off. Boris Johnson's Brexit is a roller-coaster. It's a crazy ride, with highs and lows, thrills and spills, ups and downs galore.

London | Brexit will be delayed again. Britain's population will likely throw up its hands in collective despair. Most people, it's widely believed, just want to get this thing over with.

But the punch-drunk British are probably still suffering the hangover from Theresa May's period at the helm of Brexit. This isn't like her delay, and it isn't like her defeats. Boris Johnson has taken the country somewhere new.

Boris Johnson's Brexit is a rollercoaster - up and down, but with a definite end.

May's Brexit was a carousel. Round and round it went, with no way to get off. Every defeat and delay just returned Britain to Brexit limbo.

Johnson's Brexit is a roller-coaster. It's a crazy ride, with highs and lows, thrills and spills, ups and downs galore. But it does seem to be getting somewhere. It is going to come to an end.

Johnson has a Brexit deal that the Europeans are happy with, and for which there may be a parliamentary majority in Britain. All he has to do is get it across the line.
description: Under Theresa May, a Brexit delay meant eternal limbo. Under Boris Johnson, at least there might be a way out.
